question: How can I participate in Codenovate?
answer: You can participate in this competition by clicking on the 'Register' button in the top right corner of this page.

question: Is Codenovate open to students from all universities and courses?
answer: Yes, Codenovate is open to students pursuing B.Tech/B.E. programs across ALL engineering colleges in India (Batch 2025, 2026, 2027 & 2028)

question: What should I bring to the event?
answer: Participants should bring their own laptops, chargers, and any tools or software they may need to work on their projects.

question: Is there a registration fee for participating in this competition?
answer: There is no registration fee for Round 1 (Aptitude Round/Quiz). However, there is a registration fee of ₹500 for Round 2 - Idea Submission Round.

question: Is transportation available?
answer: No, transportation will not be provided for the participants.

question: Will food be provided during the event?
answer: Yes, food and refreshments will be provided throughout the event for all participants.

question: Can I participate individually if I don't have a team?
answer: No, you cannot participate individually. Teams must consist of 3-4 members. If you don't have a team, we encourage you to team up with other participants or reach out to your friends or classmates to form a team.

question: Is there a specific format for the PowerPoint submission in Round 2?
answer: Detailed information about the PPT format will be sent to you via email after qualifying for Round 1.

question: Is the competition online or offline?
answer: Round 1 and Round 2 will be held online. Round 3 will be an offline event at KMIT.

question: How can I contact you if I have more queries?
answer: For any further queries, you can contact our Student Coordinators: SaiKrishna : 9392763643 or Jai Parmer : 9347654223. We’ll be happy to assist you!
